attributes.comment:
If I-600 processing times will truly be reduced by the increased fee structure,
then I can appreciate the rationale a bit more. However, I have two issues with
the existing I-600 processing. First, I do not understand why new fingerprints
must be taken on a subsequent filings of the I-600. The fingerprints are
stored electronically and don't ever change. Why must this process be
reconducted after the first time, wasting both time and money? Secondly, for
those of us that must refile an I-600 petition because of delays in the host
country adoption process, why must we pay the full processing fee again? If the
circumstances of the adoptive parents have not changed, is there really a need
to proceed like this is a brand new application rather than a simple
"continuation" application?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Erik Kjeldsen
